instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A No backlight after water damage
threads.message:
No backlight on <SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A after water damage.

Pin 28 on lcd connector - <SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> was corroded, re soldered this.

Pin 1 on lcd connector - <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> in diode mode shows OL in both directions in diode mode, in resistance mode shows high, then low, then high then low, like a discharging capacitor.

<DIODE>D7710</DIODE> = 306/OL
<TRANSISTOR>Q7701</TRANSISTOR> visual = looks ok
<TRANSISTOR>Q7733</TRANSISTOR> = OK
<CHIP>U7700</CHIP> = OK
<RESISTOR>R7700</RESISTOR> = OK
<TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> visual = looks ok
<RESISTOR>R7702</RESISTOR> = OK
<RESISTOR>R7701</RESISTOR> = OK

Suspect <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> / LP8548B1SQ_-04 so have ordered one of those in.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A No backlight after water damage
threads.message: Do you have an image? Hold flashlight to Apple logo in the back. <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> almost never dies, that is the last thing to replace.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A No backlight after water damage
threads.message: What usually dies ?, iv ordered in <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> and also <TRANSISTOR>Q7701</TRANSISTOR> as I cant see much else that iv not tested that would be critical for this.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A No backlight after water damage
threads.message: Have you replaced or removed the LCD connector yet? If it was corroded to begin with, best to replace it could be internally corroded or shorted. Remove it, and see what you get in diode mode on BKLT output (do not apply power of course).

threads.title: [SOLVED]<SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A No backlight after water damage
threads.message: No the only corrosion on the connector was on pin 28 which I have re soldered, none of the other pins have any corrosion at all on them. How does a connector get internally shorted as the  pins just go from the pad to the connector through a bit of plastic ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A No backlight after water damage
threads.message: Just tested and im getting 52.2v @ the connector on pin 1 (pad side) when the screen is connected and powered on.......so confused now.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A No backlight after water damage
threads.message: They get shorted internally by corrosion and burning. 52 volts suggests the boost circuit is working, but it doesn't see the load (light of the screen). Have you tried a known good 2015 screen yet? Has to be 2015 2013/2014 will give you no backlight.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A No backlight after water damage
threads.message: No I dont have any screens, if its the screen the customer will scrap it I think. Is there no way of testing it without another screen ? . The only screen I have is the original one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A No backlight after water damage
threads.message: How does the LCD cable on the screen look? Does it look burned at all?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A No backlight after water damage
threads.message: It looks fine, iv just thought I have a bunch of broken screens under the desk with cracked lcd, so il see if any of those are compatible.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A No backlight after water damage
threads.message: Ok try a 2015 if you have on first. If nothing, then first suspect would be LCD connector

threads.title: [SOLVED]<SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A No backlight after water damage
threads.message: Is there a way to tell what year they are other than comparing the lcd / webcam connectors ?, as they all just in a unmarked pile.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A No backlight after water damage
threads.message: Argh its the screen !, the old one fires up fine, better tell them the bad news :(

threads.title: [SOLVED]<SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A No backlight after water damage
threads.message:
Im guessing there is nothing I can take off these old screens to fix it ?.
[url]https://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/Original-Macbook-pro-13-retina-<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>-<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>-LCD-LED-Backlight-Strip-back-light/191670933361?hash=item2ca07a5771:g:KuUAAOSwHnFV2NfD[/url]
I found this here but wasnt sure if the screens come apart that easy.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A No backlight after water damage
threads.message: I just found this !, so may try swapping the working lcd over to the screen with the working backlight [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZLNUjeUL4N4[/url]

threads.title: [SOLVED]<SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A No backlight after water damage
threads.message: Doing LCD only on Retinas is very difficult, but it can be done.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<SIGNAL>A1502_820</SIGNAL>-4924-A No backlight after water damage
threads.message:
SUCCESS !!
So I took the screen apart, and was about to dismantle the lcd from the backlight when I noticed the cable that plugged  into the lcd end didnt  look in the best of shape and was  corroded. So I took the cable from the other screen I had and replaced that and it now works. Which is brilliant as I really wasnt looking forward to transplanting the lcd unit across. So if in doubt strip the screen down first and inspect both ends of the cable !.
